title.narrative: Accessing livelihoods for female heads of household and improving social cohesion in Kirkuk Governorate

description.narrative: The “Accessing Livelihoods for Female Heads of Household and Improving Social Cohesion” project will provide emergency livelihoods opportunities for the most vulnerable female heads of household, to allow them to support themselves and their dependents. The project recognizes the specific vulnerability of female heads of household and their children, particularly boys, who are at high risk of child labour. Additionally, the project seeks to build community cohesion and reduce tensions. Kirkuk is host to one of the highest numbers of IDPs in all of Iraq, placing a strain on basic services, which at times is affecting social cohesion. RI will provide asset replacement grants of $300 to 280 females heads of household, benefitting 280 women, and 1,120 of their dependents, of whom 560 will be female and 560 will be male. Additionally, 1,350 beneficiaries will receive social cohesion messaging (80% of them will be women and girls). Furthermore, 60 LNGO project managers (30 women and 30 men) will receive training on "Do No Harm" as a social cohesion and protection mechanism in emergency context and 20 trainers (10 women and 10 men) will receive "Training of Trainers" training on "Do No Harm for social cohesion in emergency context.
